intro: Psychotria longistipula, commonly known as the "Long-stippled Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves with prominent veins and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria longistipula is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various health purposes.
